_header: An doly season to an careful ditty
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 165; Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 156.9.
_description: Robert Henryson, The Testament of Cresseid — eighty-six stanzas rhyme royal, with Complaint in seven 9-line stanzas

BodAddC287.First Lines:
A doly seasun till a care full diteShould correspond & be
                    equiualentRight so it was when I began to writeThis tragedy the weder
                    right feruent…
BodAddC287.Last Lines:
…Of faire Creseid as I haue saied beforeSith she is dedde I
                    spake of her no more
BodAddC287.Note:
1640 transcript of Thynne’s edition by Kinaston;
                    ‘Annotationes in Triste Creseide Testamentum’ follow the poem on pp.
                    510-525; at the end on p. 525: ‘Finis. Quarto Maii 1640‘. Eng. from
                    Thynne, with Latin tr. by Kinaston, c. 1639.
BodAddC287.Editions:
Smith,  G. Gregory,
                        ed.  
             The Poems of Robert Henryson.
             3 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         55 (1906), 58 (1908), 64 (1914); rpt. New York, 1968: 1.1.

CULGg4271b.First Lines:
…This roiall ringe set with this rubie reddWhich Troilus in
                    dowrie to me sende…
CULGg4271b.Last Lines:
…Some time compted the flovere of woman hedvnder this stone
                    late leper lieth dedde
CULGg4271b.Note:
Fragment, lines 582-609, in a seventeenth-century hand from Speght (1598)
XSpeght,  Thomas. 
             The Workes of…Geffrey Chaucer.
         London, [A. Islip,] imp. G. Bishop, 1598; rev. ed. A. Islip, 1602 (STC
            5077, 5080).
CULGg4271b.Facsimiles:
Parkes,  Malcolm B.,  and  Richard Beadle.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Poetical Works. Geoffrey Chaucer. A Facsimile of Cambridge University
                Library MS Gg.4.27. 3 vols Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1979 (vol. 1); 1980 (vols. 2-3).

CamStJohn235.First Lines:
A doly season till a carefull diteShould correspond and be
                    aequivalent…
CamStJohn235.Last Lines:
…Of faire Creiseid as I haue said beforeSith shee is dedd I
                    speake of her noe more
CamStJohn235.Note: Added by a hand of s. xvi2.
CamStJohn235.Attributed Title:
The Testament of Criseide (f. 121v); Explicit Liber Troili &
                    Creiseidos (f. 128v)

Beadle,  Richard,  and  Jeremy Griffiths.

             St. John’s College, Cambridge Manuscript L. 1. A

         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, and Woodbridge: Boydell and Brewer, 1983.

EDUDc143.First Lines:
doly sassone onto ane cayrfull ditsuld corespond & be
                    eqewolent…
EDUDc143.Last Lines:
…And poell artyk com wystleand lovd & schyllAnd causit me
                    rai[ ]t agane my wyll…
